verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

similars.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.text: Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?
Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?

similars.text: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
Thou shalt not lie; he that lieth and will not repent shall be cast out.
Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

Yea, he saith unto them: Deceive and lie in wait to catch, that ye may destroy; behold, this is no harm. And thus he flattereth them, and telleth them that it is no sin to lie that they may catch a man in a lie, that they may destroy him.
Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

verses.text: For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.

similars.text: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
Therefore the Lord hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye sight.
I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.
Verily I say unto you, ye are clean, but not all; and there is none else with whom I am well pleased;
Therefore hath the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.
I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
Behold, your sins are forgiven you; you are clean before me; therefore, lift up your heads and rejoice.
But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.

Verily I say unto you, my servant William, that you are clean, but not all; repent, therefore, of those things which are not pleasing in my sight, saith the Lord, for the Lord will show them unto you.
Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently:

I have not eaten thereof in my mourning, neither have I taken away ought thereof for any unclean use, nor given ought thereof for the dead: but I have hearkened to the voice of the Lord my God, and have done according to all that thou hast commanded me.
Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, that I am God.

verses.text: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;

similars.text: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.
And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.

verses.text: And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.

similars.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

verses.text: Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?

similars.text: Behold, great and marvelous are the works of the Lord. How unsearchable are the depths of the mysteries of him; and it is impossible that man should find out all his ways. And no man knoweth of his ways save it be revealed unto him; wherefore, brethren, despise not the revelations of God.

verses.text: It is as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?

similars.text: But thou, Lord, art most high for evermore.

verses.text: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?
For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider it?

similars.text: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
A good man obtaineth favour of the Lord: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.
But it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow; because he feareth not before God.
Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.

If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?
The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

verses.text: For vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass's colt.
If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;

similars.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.
Can thine heart endure, or can thine hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with thee? I the Lord have spoken it, and will do it.
Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
(For they shall hear of thy great name, and of thy strong hand, and of thy stretched out arm;) when he shall come and pray toward this house;
Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.

verses.text: If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.

similars.text: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.
If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.
O Lord my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
And if the Lord shall say--Because of thine iniquities thou shalt be cut off from my presence--he will cause that it shall be so.
If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.

Nevertheless, thine enemy is in thine hands; and if thou rewardest him according to his works thou art justified; if he has sought thy life, and thy life is endangered by him, thine enemy is in thine hands and thou art justified.

That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the Lord; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.

If there be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the Lord thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother:
Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

And if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place be too far from thee, which the Lord thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the Lord thy God hath blessed thee:
If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

verses.text: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be steadfast, and shalt not fear:

similars.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Be not afraid of their faces: for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith the Lord.
Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.
In righteousness shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

Fear not, for thou shalt not be ashamed; neither be thou confounded, for thou shalt not be put to shame; for thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

verses.text: Because thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away:
And thine age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.

similars.text: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall spring forth speedily: and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the Lord shall be thy rearward.
And he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.

verses.text: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.

similars.text: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
Thou shalt ask, and my scriptures shall be given as I have appointed, and they shall be preserved in safety;
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Having faith on the Lord; having a hope that ye shall receive eternal life; having the love of God always in your hearts, that ye may be lifted up at the last day and enter into his rest.
That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee: because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the Lord.

verses.text: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.

similars.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the Lord your God.
In righteousness shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
And the Lord said unto him, Peace be unto thee; fear not: thou shalt not die.
Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart I have written my law, fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

verses.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.

similars.text: Wo unto the blind that will not see; for they shall perish also.

And then shall it come to pass, that the spirits of the wicked, yea, who are evil--for behold, they have no part nor portion of the Spirit of the Lord; for behold, they chose evil works rather than good; therefore the spirit of the devil did enter into them, and take possession of their house--and these shall be cast out into outer darkness; there shall be weeping, and wailing, and gnashing of teeth, and this because of their own iniquity, being led captive by the will of the devil.
And the afflicted people thou wilt save: but thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.
When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
